defect.para: This Recall applies to AmTran RS, RC, RE 3000 (rear engine) buses with air brakes built from 03/07/1995 through 01/23/1997, and AmTran RS, RC, RE 3000 (rear engine) buses with hydraulic brakes built from 06/25/1996 through 01/23/1997.

The low pressure return hoses on the power steering system may burst or blow off due to frigid temperatures that can cause the steering fluid to become more viscous. If this were to occur on units with hydraulic brakes, there would be a sudden loss of power assist on the steering and a reduction of brake power assist. On units with air brakes, there would be a loss of power assist on the steering only. This defect could cause a vehicular accident without warning which could result in personal injury or property damage, or both.

Owners will be notified of this campaign on their vehicles by Navistar. A listing of owner names and addresses has been furnished to the involved dealers to enable dealers to follow up with owners to have the vehicles corrected. You must limit the use of this listing to this campaign since the list may contain information obtained from state motor vehicle registration records and the use of such motor vehicle registration data for purposes other than this campaign is a violation of law in several states.

svcproc.title: REAR ENGINE BUS POWER STEERING RETURN HOSE REPLACEMENT PROCEDURE

svcsubproc.title: General
svcsubproc.para: It is necessary to replace all low pressure power steering return line hoses from the steering gear (air brake chassis) or the Hydro-Max unit (hydraulic brake chassis) to the power steering reservoir with the correct hose material and new clamps.

item.para: Air Brake Chassis - 12 ft. of 5/8 inch hose and 6 inches of 1/2 inch hose per bus.
Hydraulic Brake Chassis - 8 ft. of 5/8 inch hose and 2 ft. of 1/2 inch hose per bus. Use only Aeroquip FC-598-08 or FC-498-10. Available through Navistar Parts and Distribution Center.

step1.para: Obtain 5 quarts of Fleetrite power steering fluid (CH990625) per bus (No substitutes).
Obtain fourteen size #10 hose clamps per bus of part #274085R91. (Must be size #10 / no substitutes.)
In the rear engine compartment insure the ignition switch is in the off position.

Remove hoses one at a time, then match length to new hose and cut to length and re-install. Allow as much fluid as possible to drain from the stainless steel return pipes while the hoses are disconnected and properly discard. Make sure all hose nipples are clean and dry before installing new hose (do not lubricate).

Install new hoses and clamps and torque clamps to 35 inch-pounds (do not under- or over-torque). Make sure clamp is behind the bead on the tube or nipple. Refer to Figure 1. Proper hose installation and proper torque are essential to preventing loss of fluid.
Disconnect suction hose from power steering pump and allow fluid to drain from reservoir (properly discard). Reconnect suction hose. Refer to Figure 2.
It is not necessary to drain fluid from the high pressure lines, the power steering pump or the Hydro-Max unit.
Fill the power steering reservoir with new fluid, then purge power steering system of air.

svcsubproc.title: How to Purge Power Steering System of Air

step1.para: Fill reservoir with power steering fluid up to filter.
Start engine from the rear engine compartment ignition switch. When the steering fluid lowers to the black portion of the reservoir, immediately turn off the engine.
Repeat Steps 1 and 2 approximately four times.
Fill reservoir to the max. cold line indicated on the reservoir.

Start engine from the rear engine compartment ignition switch and watch the fluid level in the reservoir. If the fluid dropped more than a 1/2 inch, then Steps 1 through 4 must be performed again. If the fluid level is less than a 1/2 inch, then sufficient air has been purged from the system. After system has been sufficiently purged, turn off engine from the rear engine compartment ignition switch.

Start the engine from the ignition switch in the driver's compartment. Turn the steering wheel both directions to the stops 2 to 3 times. When the steering is in the full turn position, hold for 5 seconds.

caution.para: Do not hold in full turn position for more than 15 seconds to insure the pump is not damaged from excessive heat.

step1.para: Turn off engine from the ignition switch in the driver's compartment.

Go to the rear of the bus and check fluid level in reservoir. Add fluid if necessary. Start engine from the rear engine compartment ignition switch. If the steering fluid has a milky appearance, then turn off engine for approximately 10 minutes and repeat Step 6.
When the steering fluid does not have a milky appearance, the air has been purged.
Properly discard old hoses, clamps, and fluid.

entry.para: Hose cut lengths are estimates (it is best to match the old hose to the new and cut to required length).
Clamps are size #10 unlined worm drive band clamps, part number 274085R91.
Power steering fluid is Navistar/Fleetrite, part number CH990625. 4 to 5 quarts are required per chassis.
Replace all low pressure return hoses, clamps and top off reservoir with Fleetrite fluid

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location.

Dealers must correct all vehicles subject to this campaign at no charge to the owner, regardless of mileage, age of vehicle, or ownership, from this time forward. The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair the vehicle soon as possible.
